results.title: Visual documents
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the historical development of photography as a means of documentation and emphasizes the importance of photographic records in the fields of science, law and industry.

results.title: The Portrait
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the tradition of portrait photography. Guest photographers Arnold Newman and Judy Dater, portrait photographers with contrasting approaches, describe practical techniques for using lighting, pose, mood, and environment to create memorable photographic portraits.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: Time and motion
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Discusses action photography, demonstrating how to capture the precise instant in which all elements of the photograph come together to form the most perfect construction, tension and drama. Guest photographers describe various approaches to action photography.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: The Darkroom
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographer Jerry Burchfield demonstrates the basic steps in developing and printing photographs. He discusses photograms, dodging, burning in, toning, solarization and multiple printing.

results.title: Color
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explores the reasons for the “colour revolution” in fine art photography which occurred in the last ten years. Kenda North demonstrates her simplified version of the dye transfer colour process and discusses the way colour affects the aesthetics, dimensionality and emotional content of a photograph.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: Structure within the image
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographers Barbara Kasten and Garry Winogrand show how every photographer uses a unique structure within their work. Discusses framing, line, shape, tone and pattern and demonstrates ways to structurally improve photographs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

Photographers Barbara Kasten and Garry Winogrand show how every photographer uses a unique structure within their work. Discusses framing, line, shape, tone and pattern and demonstrates ways to structurally improve photographs.

results.title: The Film
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explores the factors to be considered when selecting film for a specific photographic situation. Commercial photographer, Jim Wood, discusses the process of choosing the most appropriate film for an assignment. Explains how the speed of a film determines its graininess, contrast, suitability for action shots, and sensitivity to various lighting conditions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: Responding to light
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Comments from well-known photographers and illustrations of their work center around the topic of the art and craft of manipulating light in the camera. Examines the effect of shutter, aperture, and camera pans. Photographers John Divola and Linda Connor discuss their work and how they use the technical aspects of photography to achieve creative effects.

results.title: A Visual heritage
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the highlights of the history of photography. Includes the pioneering work of Louis Daguerre and Nicephore Niepce which enabled the world to see itself objectively for the first time. This program features a number of historical photographs and a discussion of early photography by experts in the field.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: Howard Taylor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Painters, the sculptors: archival art series”.
Howard Taylor discusses his concern with light, the relationship between sculpture and painting, his early years as an art student and prisoner of war, and the techniques he uses to create works ranging from tempera paintings to large-scale public sculptures. He expresses his special relationship with nature. Interviewed by James Murdoch.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Painters, the sculptors: archival art series”.

He expresses his special relationship with nature. Interviewed by James Murdoch.
